title: How to Make a Tree Branch Tealight Candle Holder

steps.headline: Find a suitable branch from a fallen tree.
steps.description: If you find one, make sure it's about a feet long. This really depends on how many tea lights candles you intend to put in it.

steps.headline: Have your desktop circular saw ready.
steps.description: If you don't have any power tools, worry not - you can still do this a handsaw, but it will require a little patience.

steps.headline: Cut the branch to your desired measurements.
Grab the branch and mark the center.
steps.description: Split the branch using your cutting tool.

steps.headline: Put your tea lights on the half branch.
steps.description: Arrange them how you want them and measure/mark the locations.

steps.headline: Grab your rotary tool and use a ⁄2 inch (1.3 cm) Forstner bit.
steps.description: Again you can still do this with a plain old hammer and chisel; it will just require some basic carpentry skills.

steps.headline: Mark you measurements by putting a nail.
steps.description: Then remove the nails when placing the Forstner bit.

steps.headline: Start making the slots for the candles.
Make 4 slots.
steps.description: A foot-long branch can accommodate 4 to 5 tea lights.

steps.headline: Remove the sawdust.
steps.description: Clean the holes and then place your candles in them.

steps.headline: Place the holder in your living room, adding that rustic look to your house.
